private_information: I can move disks A B C D E F G H I J
I must only issue primitive moves for disks A through J
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves to reach the global Tower of Hanoi goal configuration

private_information: I can move disks K L M N O P Q R S T
I must only issue primitive moves for disks K through T
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves to reach the global Tower of Hanoi goal configuration

orchestrator.goal: Integrate both agents' primitive move lists and produce a PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver that encodes the cooperating two-agent Tower of Hanoi solution

public_information: This is a cooperative two-agent Tower of Hanoi instance with 20 disks labeled A through T where A is the smallest and T is the largest
Only the top disk on any peg may be moved at a time
No disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk
agent_1 is allowed to move disks A B C D E F G H I J
agent_2 is allowed to move disks K L M N O P Q R S T
Initial configuration has all disks on the left peg ordered from top A to bottom T
Goal configuration is left peg top-to-bottom E..T middle peg top-to-bottom A C D right peg top-to-bottom B
Moves must be expressed as primitive single-disk transfers between pegs

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 responsible for moving the disks A B C D E F G H I J. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must follow Tower of Hanoi rules and must only move disks from your permitted set.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. The environment initial stacks are: {environment->init->initial_stacks_top_to_bottom}. The global goal stacks are: {environment->init->goal_stacks_top_to_bottom}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only disks A through J. Use the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for each move. Do not emit PDDL. If you cannot determine moves for disks you do not control, omit them.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 responsible for moving the disks K L M N O P Q R S T. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must follow Tower of Hanoi rules and must only move disks from your permitted set.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. The environment initial stacks are: {environment->init->initial_stacks_top_to_bottom}. The global goal stacks are: {environment->init->goal_stacks_top_to_bottom}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only disks K through T. Use the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for each move. Do not emit PDDL. If you cannot determine moves for disks you do not control, omit them.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL and you must produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the two agents ordered primitive move lists into a single coherent model. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure actions are distinct per agent and the model captures pegs disks initial and goal stacks and agent move permissions.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have received these move lists: {moves_agent_1} {moves_agent_2}. Your task is to integrate the move lists, resolve conflicts, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeted for the FastDownwards solver that models two agents, three pegs, the 20 disks, the movement constraints, and achieves the specified goal configuration. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing actions or predicates as needed. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
